metadata.title: ‘Chess’ moves back to Broadway as fans line up for tickets to ‘80s revival, signed Lea Michele posters
metadata.author: ByIan Mohr

content.text: Talk about playing the long game! The cult musical “Chess” — which h only 68 regular performances on Broway before closing in 1988 but spawned a hit soundtrack by two members of ABBA — is making a comeback nearly 40 years later. The box office for a revival of the show opened Monday — and fans lined up as early as 3 a.m. outside the Imperial Theatre for tickets and a limited-edition poster signed by stars Lea Michele, Aaron Tveit and Nicholas Christopher. (Only the first 50 ticket buyers scored exclusive posters, which sent the line snaking down West 45th Street before dawn.) 6 The ’80s musical “Chess” is coming back to Broway. Bruce Glikas/WireImage 6 Tickets went on sale at the Imperial Theatre. Christopher Sowski 6 Lea Michele me her Broway debut in “Les Misérables” at the Imperial. Bruce Glikas/WireImage We hear that one superfan even slept in their car. Said an insider: “Among the early risers [was] a group of women who h alrey purchased tickets online, but came back for more,” plus fans who were armed with Playbills from the original Broway run. ding to the nostalgia: Michele me her Broway debut 30 years ago in “Les Misérables” at the Imperial. 6 The show stars Aaron Tveit, Michele and Nicholas Christopher. Bruce Glikas/WireImage 6 Director Michael Mayer is behind the new production, starring Michele. Bruce Glikas/WireImage The show — with music and lyrics by Benny Andersson, Björn Ulvaeus and Tony winner Tim Rice — follows a Cold War chess tournament between two grandmasters. The soundtrack included the hit “One Night in Bangkok,” which hit No. 3 in 1985 before the show’s West End run in 1986. The revival has a new book by celebrated screenwriter Danny Strong, whose credits include “Dope Sick,” “Empire” and “Game Change,” while Michael Mayer is directing the new production. 6 The revival h fans lining up at 3a.m. for tickets. Bruce Glikas/WireImage The Post has reported that Broway is swarming with stars this season, including former “Glee” breakout Michele — as well as as James Corden, Neil Patrick Harris and Bobby Cannavale, Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter, Kristin Chenoweth and more.

images.caption: The ’80s musical “Chess” is coming back to Broadway.Bruce Glikas/WireImage
Tickets went on sale at the Imperial Theatre.Christopher Sadowski
Lea Michele made her Broadway debut in “Les Misérables” at the Imperial.Bruce Glikas/WireImage
The show stars Aaron Tveit, Michele and Nicholas Christopher.Bruce Glikas/WireImage
Director Michael Mayer is behind the new production, starring Michele.Bruce Glikas/WireImage
The revival had fans lining up at 3a.m. for tickets.Bruce Glikas/WireImage

<a class="flag flag--stamp flag--stamp--display" href="https://pagesix.com/entertainment/">

<h1 class="headline headline--single-fallback">
		‘Chess’ moves back to Broadway as fans line up for tickets to ‘80s revival, signed Lea Michele posters	</h1>
<div aria-label="Byline" class="article-header__meta">
<div class="byline meta meta--byline">
		By <div class="byline__author">
<span><a href="https://pagesix.com/author/ian-mohr/">Ian Mohr</a></span> </div>
</div>
<div aria-label="Date published/updated" class="date meta meta--byline">
<div class="date--updated__item">
<span class="updated-text">
				Published			</span>
<span class="updated-date">Sep. 28, 2025, 3:47 p.m. ET</span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="article-header__social-icons">
<div class="social-icons social-icons--horizontal">
<div data-comment-count=""></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</header>
</div>
<div class="single__content entry-content m-bottom">
<p>Talk about playing the long game! </p>
<p>The cult musical “Chess” — which had only 68 regular performances on Broadway before closing in 1988 but spawned a hit soundtrack by two members of ABBA — is<a href="https://nypost.com/2025/09/20/entertainment/broadway-is-swarming-with-celebs-again-who-will-soar-and-who-will-run-away-in-shame/" rel="noopener" target="_blank"> making a comeback </a>nearly 40 years later.</p>
<p>The box office for a revival of the show opened Monday — and fans lined up as early as 3 a.m. outside the Imperial Theatre for tickets and a limited-edition poster signed by stars Lea Michele, Aaron Tveit and Nicholas Christopher. </p>
<p>(Only the first 50 ticket buyers scored exclusive posters, which sent the line snaking down West 45th Street before dawn.) </p>

<p>We hear that one superfan even slept in their car. </p>
<p>Said an insider: “Among the early risers [was] a group of women who had already purchased tickets online, but came back for more,” plus fans who were armed with Playbills from the original Broadway run.</p>
<p>Adding to the nostalgia: Michele <a href="https://pagesix.com/2022/06/10/lea-michele-cracks-joke-over-rumor-that-she-cant-read/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">made her Broadway debut</a> 30 years ago in “Les Misérables” at the Imperial. </p>

<p>The show — with music and lyrics by  Benny Andersson, Björn Ulvaeus and Tony winner Tim Rice — follows a Cold War chess tournament between two grandmasters. </p>
<div class="wp-block-nyp-editor-universal-promo">
<div class="universal-promo__inner"></div>
</div>
<p>The soundtrack included the hit “One Night in Bangkok,” which hit No. 3 in 1985 before the show’s West End run in 1986.</p>
<p>The revival has a new book by celebrated screenwriter Danny Strong, whose credits include “Dope Sick,” “Empire” and “Game Change,” while Michael Mayer is directing the new production. </p>

<p>The Post has reported that Broadway is swarming with stars this season, including former “Glee” breakout Michele — as well as as James Corden, Neil Patrick Harris and Bobby Cannavale, Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter, Kristin Chenoweth and more. </p>

<script class="optanon-category-C0024" type="text/plain">
			window.ga4Dims = window.ga4Dims || {};
			if ( typeof nypost_screen !== 'undefined' ) {
				window.ga4Dims.screen = nypost_screen;
			}
			
			// News Connect Global Identifier
			var ncgGetCookie = function( name ) {
				var regexp = new RegExp( '(?:^' + name + '|;*' + name + ')=(.*?)(?:;|$)', 'g' ),
					result = regexp.exec( document.cookie );

				return ( null === result ) ? null : result[1];
			}

			var ncgId = ncgGetCookie( '_ncg_id_' );
			if ( null !== ncgId ) {
				window.ga4Dims.ncg_id = ncgId;
			}

			var ncgSpId = ncgGetCookie( '_ncg_sp_id\.[^=]*' );
			if ( null !== ncgSpId ) {
				window.ga4Dims.ncg_sp_id = ncgSpId;
			}

			var gaAutId = ncgGetCookie( '_autid' );
			if ( null !== gaAutId ) {
				window.ga4Dims.ga_aut_id = gaAutId;
			}

			// Get Amazon links.
			var hasAmazon = "false";
			var links = document.links;
			var amazonLinks = [];
			var ga4EventData;
			for (var i = 0; links.length > i; i++) {
				if (
					links[i].href.indexOf('amazon.com') > 0
					&& !links[i].classList.contains('buy-button')
					&& !links[i].dataset.skipAmazonTracking
				) {
					var amazonGa4Event = JSON.stringify({
						event_name: 'ux_engagement',
						source_unit: 'amazon',
						source_position: i + 1
					});

					if (links[i].dataset.ga4Event) {
						var currentGa4Event = links[i].dataset.ga4Event;
						if (Array.isArray(currentGa4Event)) {
							currentGa4Event.push(amazonGa4Event);
							ga4EventData = currentGa4Event;
						} else {
							ga4EventData = '[' + currentGa4Event + ',' + amazonGa4Event + ']';
						}
					} else {
						ga4EventData = amazonGa4Event;
					}

										links[i].setAttribute(
						'data-ga4-event',
						ga4EventData
					);
					
					amazonLinks.push(links[i].href);
					hasAmazon = "amazon";
				}
			}
			window.ga4Dims.contains_commerce_link = hasAmazon;

			if (amazonLinks.length > 0) {
				window.ga4Dims.commerce_links = amazonLinks.join();
			}

					</script>
<script type="text/javascript">
			// Send an event on clicks for link elements with data-nyp-affiliate="true", wait until the document has loaded.
			document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
				const affiliateLinks = document.querySelectorAll('a[data-nyp-affiliate="true"]');
				// Return early if we don't have any links.
				if ( ! affiliateLinks ) {
					return;
				}
				// Loop through the links and add the event listener.
				affiliateLinks.forEach(function(link) {
					link.addEventListener('click', function(event) {

						const {
							nypScripts: {
								nypost_wp_vars: {
									nypostSite: siteId = '',
								} = {},
							} = {},
						} = window;

						// Check if we are on the element with the a[data-nyp-affiliate="true"].
						let link = event.target;
						if ( 'true' !== link.dataset.nypAffiliate ) {
							// If not, get the closest one then get the href from that.
							link = event.target.closest('a[data-nyp-affiliate="true"]');
						}

						// Get the URL from the link.
						let href = link.href || '';

						// Bail if we don't have a href.
						if ( ! href ) {
							return;
						}

						// If the URL does not have the protocol we need to add it or URL() will throw an error.
						if (!href.startsWith('http://') && !href.startsWith('https://')) {
							href = 'https://' + href;
						}

						// Get the URL from the link.
						if (href.match(new RegExp(`https?://go.${siteId}.com/`))) {
							// Extract the URL from the skimlinks href.
							href = new URL(href).searchParams.get('url') || href;
						}

						// Ensure Trackonomics links "clicks.trx-hub.com" send the correct data to gtag.
						if (href.includes('clicks.trx-hub.com')) {
							// assign the original url (q parameter) from the href variable
							href = decodeURIComponent(new URL(href).searchParams.get('q')) || href;
						}

						// Get the URL hostname, for example: www.amazon.com.
						const retailer = new URL(href).hostname;

						gtag('event', 'outbound', {
							'internal_source': window.location.href,
							'external_destination': href,
							'retailer': retailer,
							'post_id': "8535130",
						});
					});
				});
			});
		</script>
